chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier Will-Morris Kirk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xavier Will-Morris Kirk not in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Xavier Will-Morris Kirk.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs the court of Mr. Kirk's medical issues.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Attorney Findling states that defendant is hospitalized, requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant not appearing. Court waives defendant's appearance. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier Will-Morris Kirk in court with Attorney Jason A Findling.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer H. Young.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Xavier Will-Morris Kirk in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Xavier Will-Morris Kirk in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xavier Will-Morris Kirk appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
